data.text: @calvinthehuman While these kits are safe, effective, and beneficial for self-testing, the product labelling and instructions may not describe risks associated with misuse/accidental ingestion. This advisory issued by Health Canada is intended to help fill that labelling gap.^DT

@calvinthehuman Hi Calvin! Health Canada has determined that the kits are safe and effective when used as intended. However, many test kits include liquid solutions with chemical preservatives that may be harmful if swallowed/absorbed through the skin, particularly in children and pets. (1/2)
@VCHhealthcare Is this the same thing? https://t.co/aJEBWDbtj7

@VCHhealthcare @CDCofBC Naz's Prescription Pharmacy at 6410 Main St. in Vancity is NOT following guideline of 1 RAT kit per person over 70. They are only giving ONE kit per HOUSEHOLD. Refusing to honour Carecards from same household. Have to go to pharmacy that follows policy.
